verses.niv: 2 When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom.
verses.kjv: 2 When pride cometh, then cometh shame: but with the lowly is wisdom.
verses.esv:
2   When pride comes, then comes disgrace,
    but with the humble is wisdom.

verses.niv: 18 Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall.
verses.kjv: 18 Pride goeth before destruction, and an haughty spirit before a fall.
verses.esv:
18   Pride goes before destruction,
    and a haughty spirit before a fall.

verses.niv: 23 A man's pride brings him low, but a man of lowly spirit gains honor.
verses.kjv: 23 A man’s pride shall bring him low: but honour shall uphold the humble in spirit.
verses.esv:
23   One’s pride will bring him low,
    but he who is lowly in spirit will obtain honor.

verses.niv: 13 To fear the LORD is to hate evil; I hate pride and arrogance, evil behavior and perverse speech.
verses.kjv: 13 The fear of the LORD is to hate evil: pride, and arrogancy, and the evil way, and the froward mouth, do I hate.
verses.esv:
13   The fear of the LORD is hatred of evil.
  Pride and arrogance and the way of evil
    and perverted speech I hate.

verses.niv: 6 But he gives us more grace. That is why Scripture says: "God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble."
verses.kjv: 6 But he giveth more grace. Wherefore he saith, God resisteth the proud, but giveth grace unto the humble.
verses.esv: 6 But he gives more grace. Therefore it says, “God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble.”

verses.niv: 5 The LORD detests all the proud of heart. Be sure of this: They will not go unpunished.
verses.kjv: 5 Every one that is proud in heart is an abomination to the LORD: though hand join in hand, he shall not be unpunished.
verses.esv:
5   Everyone who is arrogant in heart is an abomination to the LORD;
    be assured, he will not go unpunished.

verses.niv: 4 In his pride the wicked does not seek him; in all his thoughts there is no room for God.
verses.kjv: 4 The wicked, through the pride of his countenance, will not seek after God: God is not in all his thoughts.
verses.esv:
4   In the pride of his face the wicked does not seek him;
    all his thoughts are, “There is no God.”

verses.niv: 12 Before his downfall a man's heart is proud, but humility comes before honor.
verses.kjv: 12 Before destruction the heart of man is haughty, and before honour is humility.
verses.esv:
12   Before destruction a man’s heart is haughty,
    but humility comes before honor.

verses.niv: 16 For everything in the world--the cravings of sinful man, the lust of his eyes and the boasting of what he has and does--comes not from the Father but from the world.
verses.kjv: 16 For all that is in the world, the lust of the flesh, and the lust of the eyes, and the pride of life, is not of the Father, but is of the world.
verses.esv: 16 For all that is in the world—the desires of the flesh and the desires of the eyes and pride of life—is not from the Father but is from the world.

verses.niv: 10 Pride only breeds quarrels, but wisdom is found in those who take advice.
verses.esv:
10   By insolence comes nothing but strife,
    but with those who take advice is wisdom.
verses.kjv: 10 Only by pride cometh contention: but with the well advised is wisdom.

verses.esv: 16 Live in harmony with one another. Do not be haughty, but associate with the lowly. Never be wise in your own sight.
verses.niv: 16 Live in harmony with one another. Do not be proud, but be willing to associate with people of low position. Do not be conceited.
verses.kjv: 16 Be of the same mind one toward another. Mind not high things, but condescend to men of low estate. Be not wise in your own conceits.

verses.esv: 3 For if anyone thinks he is something, when he is nothing, he deceives himself.
verses.niv: 3 If anyone thinks he is something when he is nothing, he deceives himself.
verses.kjv: 3 For if a man think himself to be something, when he is nothing, he deceiveth himself.

verses.esv: 3 Do nothing from selfish ambition or conceit, but in humility count others more significant than yourselves.
verses.niv: 3 Do nothing out of selfish ambition or vain conceit, but in humility consider others better than yourselves.
verses.kjv: 3 Let nothing be done through strife or vainglory; but in lowliness of mind let each esteem other better than themselves.

verses.niv: 2 Let another praise you, and not your own mouth; someone else, and not your own lips.
verses.esv:
2   Let another praise you, and not your own mouth;
    a stranger, and not your own lips.
verses.kjv: 2 Let another man praise thee, and not thine own mouth; a stranger, and not thine own lips.

verses.niv: 12 Do you see a man wise in his own eyes? There is more hope for a fool than for him.
verses.esv:
12   Do you see a man who is wise in his own eyes?
    There is more hope for a fool than for him.
verses.kjv: 12 Seest thou a man wise in his own conceit? there is more hope of a fool than of him.

verses.niv: 4 Haughty eyes and a proud heart, the lamp of the wicked, are sin!
verses.esv:
4   Haughty eyes and a proud heart,
    the lamp of the wicked, are sin.
verses.kjv: 4 An high look, and a proud heart, and the plowing of the wicked, is sin.

verses.niv: 4 Each one should test his own actions. Then he can take pride in himself, without comparing himself to somebody else,
verses.kjv: 4 But let every man prove his own work, and then shall he have rejoicing in himself alone, and not in another.
verses.esv: 4 But let each one test his own work, and then his reason to boast will be in himself alone and not in his neighbor.

verses.niv: 23 This is what the LORD says: "Let not the wise man boast of his wisdom or the strong man boast of his strength or the rich man boast of his riches,
verses.kjv: 23 Thus saith the LORD, Let not the wise man glory in his wisdom, neither let the mighty man glory in his might, let not the rich man glory in his riches:
verses.esv: 23 Thus says the LORD: “Let not the wise man boast in his wisdom, let not the mighty man boast in his might, let not the rich man boast in his riches,

verses.niv: 12 For the sins of their mouths, for the words of their lips, let them be caught in their pride. For the curses and lies they utter,
verses.kjv: 12 For the sin of their mouth and the words of their lips let them even be taken in their pride: and for cursing and lying which they speak.
verses.esv:
12   For the sin of their mouths, the words of their lips,
    let them be trapped in their pride.
  For the cursing and lies that they utter,

verses.niv: 10 Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will lift you up.
verses.kjv: 10 Humble yourselves in the sight of the Lord, and he shall lift you up.
verses.esv: 10 Humble yourselves before the Lord, and he will exalt you.

verses.niv: 5 Young men, in the same way be submissive to those who are older. All of you, clothe yourselves with humility toward one another, because, "God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble."
verses.kjv: 5 Likewise, ye younger, submit yourselves unto the elder. Yea, all of you be subject one to another, and be clothed with humility: for God resisteth the proud, and giveth grace to the humble.
verses.esv: 5 Likewise, you who are younger, be subject to the elders. Clothe yourselves, all of you, with humility toward one another, for “God opposes the proud but gives grace to the humble.”

verses.niv: 3 The pride of your heart has deceived you, you who live in the clefts of the rocks and make your home on the heights, you who say to yourself, 'Who can bring me down to the ground?'
verses.kjv: 3 The pride of thine heart hath deceived thee, thou that dwellest in the clefts of the rock, whose habitation is high; that saith in his heart, Who shall bring me down to the ground?
verses.esv:
3   The pride of your heart has deceived you,
    you who live in the clefts of the rock,
    in your lofty dwelling,
  who say in your heart,
    “Who will bring me down to the ground?”

verses.niv: 6 Though the LORD is on high, he looks upon the lowly, but the proud he knows from afar.
verses.kjv: 6 Though the LORD be high, yet hath he respect unto the lowly: but the proud he knoweth afar off.
verses.esv:
6   For though the LORD is high, he regards the lowly,
    but the haughty he knows from afar.

verses.niv: 24 The proud and arrogant man-"Mocker" is his name; he behaves with overweening pride.
verses.kjv: 24 Proud and haughty scorner is his name, who dealeth in proud wrath.
verses.esv:
24   “Scoffer” is the name of the arrogant, haughty man
    who acts with arrogant pride.

verses.niv: 19 Better to be lowly in spirit and among the oppressed than to share plunder with the proud.
verses.kjv: 19 Better it is to be of an humble spirit with the lowly, than to divide the spoil with the proud.
verses.esv:
19   It is better to be of a lowly spirit with the poor
    than to divide the spoil with the proud.
